basics.name: Nicholas
basics.label: Web developer
basics.summary: I'm self-tough and technology geek. I enjoy spectating how the web is changing and glad being a part of this. I like new stuff, but I respect older. I prefer a command line to GUI, Arch Linux to Ubuntu, Emacs to Vim, Dvorak to QWERTY, Redux to MVC, ES6 to subsets, gulp to grunt. I consider that ES6 and the libraries like React, Angular2, Vue and Cycle.js is the right way to move on. Libraries like Redux and Immutableljs makes the web even better with predictable states,makes it easy to debug and showing us a new way to think of our applications.

work.summary: Checkmarx is a company providing comprehensive solutions for automated security code review. The company pioneered the concept of a query language-based solution for identifying technical and logical code vulnerabilities.
highlights: Was part of the UI angular team, built the new system from scratch using Angularjs 1.6.1 and one way data bindings, Observable/Observer pattern using RxJs for data stream manipulations, Stylus for styles.

work.summary: Eternitech is a sowftware company specilized on web development and outsource
highlights: Did mobile and web applications from scratch using Angularjs, Ionic, Nodejs et.c.
Saved tons of hours for project managers, by writing a bot-parser for the job offering website using PhantomJs/CasperJs, NodeJs/Express

work.summary: Fifth Dimension has developed specialized systems to analyze immense amounts of data in real time, using advanced artificial intelligence technology. As web developer I worked there with React/Redux/Immutable stack.

volunteer.summary: Prontoly developed proximity-based authentication technology that identifies users via their mobile device. This connection is made through the emission and detection of imperceptible sounds using the device’s microphone and speakers and doesn’t require any extra hardware or user action. Have a practice there as a part of MASA program. I worked mostly in front-end with AngularJs and developed chrome extension and website based on it. Also worked with Raspberry PI.
highlights: Developed Raspberry PI ultrasonic receiver module for Pronto.ly software

education.institution: The National Metallurgical Academy of Ukraine
Dnipropetrovsk University of Economics and Law
